definition: to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I'm pleased to brother in the four class vomit vomit tongue.
sentences.chinese: 我高兴的向哥哥所在的四一班吐了吐舌头。

sentences.english: I playfully spit of the tongue, and turned away.
sentences.chinese: 我调皮地吐了吐舌头，转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Huahua is 7 months old now. She loves to shout and sticking her tongou old.
sentences.chinese: 花花7个月了，特喜欢吐舌头和大声乱喊。

sentences.english: Did I just stick my tongue out at her?
sentences.chinese: 我刚才是在向她吐舌头吗？

sentences.english: Even if all they're doing is sticking out their tongue.
sentences.chinese: 即使他们所做的只是吐吐舌头。

sentences.english: That impudent boy put his tongue out at me.
sentences.chinese: 那个无礼的男孩冲著我吐舌头。

sentences.english: And when the experimenter stuck his tongue out, infants stuck theirs out.
sentences.chinese: 实验者吐舌头的时候，婴儿才吐舌头。

sentences.english: And when the experimenter stuck his tongue out, infants stuck theirs out.
sentences.chinese: 实验者吐舌头的时候，婴儿才吐舌头。

sentences.english: You are snarling, I am out my tongue at you.
sentences.chinese: 你在咆哮而我在向你吐舌头。

sentences.english: Examples : a) It's very rude to stick your tongue out at people.
sentences.chinese: 向别人吐舌头是非常不礼貌的。

sentences.english: It's rude to put out your tongues at people.
sentences.chinese: 对人吐舌头是不礼貌的。

definition: wry face/to grimace/to pull a face/comic face/face mask/devil mask
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
to pout (to express anger or displeasure)
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
